content.data: How to Differentiate Between Multiple Parts

When there is more than one part with the same name you use the "@" (at) symbol to differentiate between them. Example say there where five boards, the first one would be BOARD or BOARD@1, the second one would be BOARD@2 the third one would be BOARD@3, the fourth one would be BOARD@4, Etc.

For the first part in the list you dont have to use the "@" (at) symbol. If you just type BOARD, the program goes to the first BOARD on the list, or if you type BOARD@1 it goes to the first BOARD on the list. Its all the same to the program, but for the other parts you must use the "@" symbol and what number the part is in the list.
